result.execSummary:
The defendant Hope K Mayer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS Eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs.
Concurrent with: Present Sentence

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.

Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Work towards employment and/or school combination. No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: As a condition of probation, commencing forthwith. Non-working hours. Release for standard conditions. Sentence credit of 76 days were granted.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Hope K Mayer
Current: W151 S6498 Glenbrook Dr, Muskego, WI 53150 United States  (Effective: 03-28-2016)
Prior: 21425-A Spring Street, c/o Robert E. Ellsworth Correctional Center, Union Grove, WI 53182-9408 United States

Notice of Case Status Change - Defendant Deceased
  Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been converted to a civil judgment.
detainer cancellation filed.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Hope K Mayer in court, in custody, with Attorney Katie Beth Bricco.   Attorney Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called for plea and sentencing hearing. Defendant pleads guilty to Count #1. Court performs plea colloquy and finds defendant guilty of Count #1. Repeat enhancer is stricken. Count #2 is dismissed and read in. State gives sentencing recommendations. Attorney Bricco makes statements regarding sentencing. Defendant makes statements.

The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

COUNT#1:

The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

3 YEARS IMPRISONMENT                                      ****CONCURRENT WITH PRESENT SENTENCE****
  -  18 MONTHS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  18 MONTHS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

TERM OF PROBATION: 2 YEARS

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs / paraphernalia;
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed.
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____work towards employment and/or combination of schooling 
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 
____No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.

COSTS:  $268 + $250 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME: 

9 MONTHS Jail, Non-working hours with standard release conditions to commence forthwith. (76 days credit given.)

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
